Matching Summary

Important Notice

The number of matches are likely to be greater than number of exports in the system due to below scenarios:

  1. In case of components-to-finished goods matching (many-to-one matching between imports & exports)
  2. In case of partial matching an export entry with multiple imports
  3. Total Successful Matches Entries = Reviewer Consol Entries + Pending Approval Entries + Approved Entries.

Documentation

Customs Drawbacks Enterprise Guide

This section outlines the end-to-end product workflow and explains key terminology used within the application. For comprehensive, step-by-step instructionsâ€”including detailed screenshotsâ€”users may download the full User Guide here.

PDF Manual Download Full Guide
1

Customs Drawbacks Workflow

Data Upload & Validation

Users upload four data files. Product Master and Materials Mapping are one-time reference uploads, while Import and Export files are uploaded incrementally. All files are system-validated, and users must correct any errors before committing the data.

Matching Engine

Users manually trigger the matching process and select a matching methodology, such as FIFO or Highest Duty Paid. The system then matches eligible import and export records.

Review & Prep

Reviewers validate matched entries and group them into claims or batches for submission. Approvers are automatically notified via email when claims are ready for review.

Approval

Approvers can fully or partially approve claims, or reject them with a required reason. Rejected items are routed back to the Reviewer for follow-up.

Broker Submission

Approved claims can be downloaded and submitted to the broker offline. Based on broker feedback, entries may be voided prior to final submission. A final Claims ID is then added by the reviewer, and completed claims remain accessible in the system for up to five years for audit and compliance purposes.

2

Data Management

Data Validation Rules

The system applies strict pre-commit validations to all uploaded Import, Export, Product Master and Materials Mapping files. These validations apply to mandatory fields and are executed before data is committed to the database to ensure data quality and compliance. Please note that once data is committed, records cannot be deleted or modified.

Key Validation Checks
  • Date validations: Import and Export dates must be valid and not in the future.
  • Material validations: Material references must align with approved master and mapping data.
  • Quantity validations: Quantities must be numeric, positive, and within allowable limits.
  • UOM validations: UOMs must match an approved list and remain consistent across files.
  • Duty and financial: Duty values must be numeric, non-negative, and properly formatted.
  • Identifier validations: Mandatory identifiers must follow defined formats and must not be missing.

Handling of Missing and Invalid Data

To ensure data completeness and accuracy, the system applies controlled remediation and error-handling mechanisms during validation.

System-Assisted Data Completion

Where mandatory data is missing, the system attempts to populate the information using approved Materials Mapping and Product Master reference tables. Fields populated through this process are highlighted in Yellow to indicate system-derived values requiring user review.

Invalid Data Identification

Records containing erroneous or invalid data are flagged and prevented from submission. Affected rows are highlighted in Red and accompanied by a brief error description indicating the issue. Users must review and resolve all highlighted items before proceeding.

3

The Matching Engine

The matching engine applies rule-based logic to identify eligible importâ€“export relationships while ensuring compliance and financial accuracy.

Strategy Selection

FIFO : First-In, First-Out (Default)
Consumes the oldest available import inventory first and aligns with standard compliance practices.
Maximize Duty
Prioritizes imports with the highest duty paid to optimize financial recovery.

Core Calculations

  • 1
    Date Integrity Check

    Imports are eligible only when Import Date â‰¤ Export Date; later imports are excluded.

  • 2
    Unit Conversion

    Quantities are converted using Product Master reference data.
    Formula: Export Qty * Conversion Factor = Required Import Qty

  • 3
    Financial Calculation

    Refund is calculated as: (Matched Qty * Unit Duty) * 0.99 Note: 1% is retained by government statute.

Roles & Responsibilities

The application uses role-based controls to enforce segregation of duties and ensure audit-ready processing.

Reviewer (Data Steward)

The Reviewer is responsible for preparing, validating, and submitting claims for approval. Key responsibilities include:

  • Uploading reference data, including Product Master and Materials Mapping files.
  • Uploading incremental Import and Export data files.
  • Executing the importâ€“export matching engine using the selected strategy.
  • Reviewing and auditing system-generated matching results & grouping validated entries into Claims and submitting them for approval.
Approver (Authorizer)

The Approver provides final authorization of reviewed claims. Key responsibilities include:

  • Reviewing claims submitted by the Reviewer.
  • Approving claims, which locks entries and prevents further modification.
  • Returning (rejecting) claims or individual items with a mandatory reason for rejection.

Claims Status Glossary

The following statuses indicate the lifecycle stage and processing state of a claim within the system:

DRAFT System-generated matches that are pending review. Visible to the Reviewer for validation and preparation.
REVIEWED Matches that have been grouped into a claim and submitted for approval. Visible to the Approver.
APPROVED Claims that have been internally approved and are ready for submission to the broker.
COMPLETE Claims that have been filed with Customs and have an associated Broker or Filing ID.
VOIDED Claims that have been cancelled post-approval. Associated inventory quantities are restored and made available for future matching.

Critical: The Broker Handshake

A claim is not considered finished until you locate it in the History tab and click "Mark Final". You must enter the external Broker Claim ID (e.g., from ACE). This action stamps the final approval date and locks the record as "COMPLETE".

Enterprise Support

For any issues or assistance, please contact the MoonSlate Support team at support@moonslate.ai. Include a brief description of the issue and any relevant reference details to help expedite resolution. Support requests are handled in line with established support procedures.
